comments: All terms are divisible by 15. - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 21 2015
references: Sylvester Smith, "A Set of Conjectures on Smarandache Sequences", Bulletin of Pure and Applied Sciences, (Bombay, India), Vol. 15 E (No. 1), 1996, pp. 101-107.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = n*10^floor[log10(5*n)+1]+5*n, with n>=1. [_Paolo P. Lava_, Mar 24 2010]
mathematica: n5n[n_]:=Module[{n5=5n},n*10^IntegerLength[n5]+n5]; Array[n5n,40] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 08 2012 *)nxt[n_]:=Module[{idn=IntegerDigits[n], idn5=IntegerDigits[5n]}, FromDigits[Join[idn, idn5]]]; Array[nxt, 100] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 04 2014 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [Seqint(Intseq(5*n) cat Intseq(n)): n in [1..50]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 04 2014(PARI) a(n) = eval(Str(n, 5*n)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 21 2015
author: R. Muller
